tweet:
Earlier today, I called for a sober review of our policy in the Middle East. 

Moments ago, with the tweet below, President Trump made clear that’s not at all what he wants. pic.twitter.com/l7AUwKv94E

This is an extremely alarming development. 

We must move swiftly to ensure the safety of every American servicemember and diplomat stationed at our embassy in Iraq.

Then we must proceed with a sober review of how we can reduce tensions in the region. https://apnews.com/75228a8a607a44863b57021ac33264dc?utm_medium=AP&utm_campaign=SocialFlow&utm_source=Twitter …

The State Department ran a full blown investigation to find out who at the US Embassy in Brussels liked a Chelsea Clinton tweet. 

We get closer and closer to a banana republic each day @realdonaldtrump stays in office. https://www.thedailybeast.com/trumpworlds-wild-hunt-who-liked-a-chelsea-clinton-tweet …

There are no words to describe the tragedy of another shooting in a place of worship.

These senseless acts of violence must stop. 

The time to act is now. https://abcnews.go.com/US/injuries-reported-shooting-texas-church/story?id=67969564 …

The attack on a Hannukah celebration last night was horrifying and barbaric.

It is another in a streak of hate crimes intended to intimidate Jewish communities that have become all too common.

We are better than this. America is better than this. https://nyti.ms/2tgki0l

I’m keeping the Conscience of the House, @repjohnlewis, in my thoughts and prayers tonight. 

You’re not alone in this fight, my friend. The whole nation, which owes you an incredible debt, is with you. https://twitter.com/saba_h/status/1211422047303172096 …
Especially grateful I was able to spend some time with Henry Camacho from Woonsocket and other brave servicemembers spending the holidays away from their loved ones! pic.twitter.com/b9HpN90wSi

We just left Qatar after spending Christmas Day with our brave men and women in uniform stationed at Al Udeid Air Base.

Glad that we were able to serve them Christmas breakfast and dinner and listen to them about their mission there. pic.twitter.com/gU4mq6lWwY

I was also able to serve servicemembers Christmas lunch and bring them a little piece of home. 

More updates to come! pic.twitter.com/kPIMpa4zet

Spent Christmas Eve with troops deployed to the Naval Forces Central Command Headquarters in Bahrain yesterday.

We had the opportunity to thank them for their tremendous service in defense of our great nation during the holiday season. pic.twitter.com/wU8Pzg4V8Y

Especially thankful that I was able to see Pawtucket resident Staff Sergeant Max Silva, who works as our Veterans Affairs Advocate in my Pawtucket office. 

I was able to bring gifts from his family, including his daughter, who are spending the holidays without him. pic.twitter.com/9lMBqrS2p4

Just departed Kuwait, where I was able to spend the day with servicemembers from across the nation, including RI National Guardsmen & women.

Stay tuned for updates on our surprise visit to spend the holidays with troops stationed in the Middle East. pic.twitter.com/xEZLchAbic

36 hours ago, the Town of Westerly, Rhode Island was shattered by gun violence. 

This town, another in a long line, has come together over the past few days to support the victims and to heal.

Too many towns have felt the pain we are feeling tonight. We have got to do better.
It’s so unlikely, it might warrant some congressional recognition.  😂
This is true. https://twitter.com/BresPolitico/status/1207734920619053056 …
Closely monitoring the situation in Westerly. Keeping the victims and first responders in my thoughts.

The facts are undisputed, and it is therefore our duty to our country and to the Constitution to hold this lawless President accountable. 

Every member of the Senate will have to consider that duty when they review the evidence of this case.

This President is unfit to serve.

He abused the enormous power of his office for his own personal benefit when he solicited foreign interference to help him in his re-election campaign.

His conduct is a continued threat to our democracy and the national security of our country.
I just voted to impeach President Trump.

I assume I’m not the only Representative to get this. How much taxpayer money did the White House waste sending the President’s crazy letter in a ridiculous oversized envelope? pic.twitter.com/TMldjUpl3X
Just spoke on the House floor during debate on the articles of impeachment against President Trump. pic.twitter.com/y4mw5Vt6ch
About to speak in support of impeachment on the House floor.
.@realdonaldtrump, please stop embarrassing our country
Well said! @RepAdamSchiff https://twitter.com/RepAdamSchiff/status/1205585316922478594 …

We’d win lots more races if more folks like @EricHyers & Nicole Kayner were available to manage.  No surprise he was asked to speak. Two of the most talented people I know! https://twitter.com/richluchette/status/1206014183063470080 …
Lauren, thanks for the invitation but I’ll be back in DC. We have session on Tuesday.

Congresswoman Debbie Dingell has been an important partner for me through her service as Co-Chair of the DPCC. She is a strong voice for her district and the President’s attack on her tonight is shameful.

We cannot overstate the damage Bill Barr is doing to the rule of law. https://twitter.com/JohnJHarwood/status/1204453273656340480 …
We will proceed with the only remedy provided to us in our Constitution.
Nearly 250 years ago, our Founding Fathers envisioned that our country might face a crisis like the one before us today.
Donald Trump has given us no other choice than to move forward with impeachment.

The articles of impeachment that we developed in the Judiciary Committee capture the scope of his most serious misconduct, including referencing his pattern of wrongdoing. In our country, no one is above the law, not even the President.

His actions undermined our national security. President Trump put his own personal, political interests ahead of our country’s interest. His conduct makes him a clear and present danger to both our democracy and our national security.

The facts are beyond dispute. President Trump abused his office, the enormous power of the presidency, to solicit foreign interference in an American election, specifically to help in his re-election.

Just introduced a bill to fight the persecution of religious minorities around the world by reforming the US Commission on International Religious Freedom, making it more transparent, and giving it new tools. This needs to remain a pillar of our foreign policy.
“A republic, if you can keep it.”
